## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I have a question about staking. Can I stake with the same wallet.dat on multiple nodes?

**AI Assistant:**
No, you should not stake with the same wallet.dat on multiple nodes. This is not a recommended or supported configuration. It's best to keep each node with its own unique wallet.dat for staking.

**User:**
Okay, that makes sense. I'm planning to set up a machine for staking using Verus CLI. Do I need to use the Agama GUI wallet for staking on this machine?

**AI Assistant:**
No, the Agama GUI wallet is not required to stake on a permanently running machine using Verus CLI. You can stake without using the Agama GUI wallet. You can set up your daemon for staking using the CLI commands.

**User:**
Great, thanks for the clarification! How do I configure my Verus daemon for staking, exactly?

**AI Assistant:**
To set up your daemon for staking, you need to create a transparent address, a zs address, and run the daemon with the correct parameters. Specifically, you'll need to use the `-mint` and `-cheatcatcher=zs...` options when running the daemon. This will allow your node to stake and participate in the Verus network.
Can I stake with the same wallet.dat on multiple nodes?
No, you should not stake with the same wallet.dat on multiple nodes. This is not a recommended or supported configuration.

# PHP staking interface for coinshielding nodes.
Attention: Read it completely before using.

### Important General Information
`VRSC Wallet and Data location` on Linux: `~/.komodo/VRSC`

### Necessary files:
Link 1: [Download latest Wallet](https://verus.io/wallet)
Link 2: [Download Bootstrap](https://bootstrap.verus.io/)
Link 3: [Go to Verus-Staking-CLI](https://github.com/kbs1/verus-staking-cli)

## Procedure:
These tools will help you stake on your permanently running machine using Verus CLI, instead of running the Agama GUI wallet.

### Features
 automatic shielding and unshielding of coinbase (staking, solo mining)
 automatic tracking of total coins generated (also present in e-mail notifications)
 optional e-mail notifications on newly generated coins
 optional periodical wallet.dat backups, also as an encrypted ZIP archive
 optional periodical wallet balance e-mail notifications

Initial Verus daemon configuration
 Follow the guide in link 3 above to set-up your daemon for the first time. You will need a transparent address, a zs address and the daemon running with correct parameters (`-mint -cheatcatcher=zs...`).

Do not stake with the same `wallet.dat` on multiple nodes.

Submitted by @kbs1

Note: last revision date 2020-11-11.
Is the Agama GUI wallet required to stake on a permanently running machine using Verus CLI?
No, the Agama GUI wallet is not required to stake on a permanently running machine using Verus CLI. You can stake without using the Agama GUI wallet.
